decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin on or before 26 February 2010, (i.e. no later than 3 years from the date of planning permission 00507/AE/P1 which was granted on 26 February 2010.)

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings:1480/6B Received: 22 June 2017. 1480/1A Received: 27 October 2017. SuDs Maintenance Regime Received: 3 October 2017. 16837/2001 C,Thermal Envelope U-Values as built, Energy Strategy (Ref:0884/AMD), Waste Recycling Statement, Rainstream Home Tank Installation Details, Storm Sewer Design by the Modified Rational Method (dated , Construction Waste Recycling Statement, Sustainable Drainage Statement and Rural Runoff Calculator Received: 22 June 2017. SBEM Main Calculation Output Document and BRUKL Output Document  Received: 30 November 2017. 16837/2000A, 16837/2001C, Foul drainage- discharge unit design BS EN 12056 DU Rate, Existing ICP Sustainable Urban Drainage Rates Calculator Received: 25 January 2018 . Agent dated 30th November 2017 confirming the external finish of the windows and doors. Agent email dated 3rd October confirming drainage details. Location Plan, 788-01-B, 788-020-SK-A and Design and Access Statement Received: 2 May 2009. Sustainability checklist Received: 17 August 2009. Transport Assessment and Travel Plan Received: 2 November 2009.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of  8am  to  6pm on Mondays to Friday and    9am  to    1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The hereby permitted development shall be implemented in accordance with approved application 00507/AE/P1(5,6).
Condition : 5 - The boundary treatment shall be implemented in accordance with approved application 00507/AE/P1(7).
Condition : 6 - The materials used on the building shall be implemented in accordance with  approved application 00507/AE/P1(9).
Condition : 7 - The provision to be made for disabled people to gain access to the building shall be implemented in accordance with approved application 00507/AE/P1(10).
Condition : 8 - No additional floorspace shall be formed within the buildings hereby permitted by means of horizontal division without prior written consent to the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 9 - The bird hazard management plan shall be implemented in accordance with approved application 00507/AE/P1(10,13).
Condition : 10 - The permanent lighting scheme shall be implemented in accordance  with approved application 00507/AE/P1(15).
Condition : 11 - All boilers installed must be low NOx boilers, conforming to at least NOX class 3 or better.
Condition : 12 - The proposal gives permission for B1c, B2 and B8 uses. Any trade counter element or office use of the future operations of the unit shall remain ancillary to the main use.

Condition : 13 - 13.	Within a month from the date of this permission, the following  components of a scheme to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site shall each be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the local planning authority:
1) A preliminary risk assessment which has identified: 
"	All previous uses
"	Potential contaminants associated with those uses
"	A conceptual model of the site indicating sources, pathways and receptors
"	Potentially unacceptable risks arising from contamination at the site.
2) A site investigation scheme, based on (1) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those off site.
3) The site investigation results and the detailed risk assessment (2) and, based on these, an options appraisal and remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken.
4) A verification plan providing details of the data that will be collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in (3) are complete and identifying any requirements for longer-term monitoring of pollutant linkages, maintenance and arrangements for contingency action.
Any changes to these components require the express consent of the local planning authority. The scheme shall be implemented as approved.
Within a month from the date of this decision , a verification report demonstrating completion of the works set out in the approved remediation strategy and the effectiveness of the remediation shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the local planning authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out in accordance with the approved verification plan to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria have been met. It shall also include any plan (a long-term monitoring and maintenance plan) for longer-term monitoring of pollutant linkages, maintenance and arrangements for contingency action, as identifi
Condition : 14 - No more than 225 people shall be employed at the site at any one time without the written authorisation of the Local Planning Authority.
description: Removal of conditions 4 (materials), 8 (carbon emissions), 11 (waste & recycling storeage), 14 (sustainable drainage scheme) and 21 (foul & surface water) of planning permission 00507/AE/P1 approved 26/02/2010 for the alteration of an extant planning permission during the course of development to construct a new B1c, B2 and B8 Industrial Warehouse.
